ONE

[BIANCA]331-bianca

The first time [I]1777-lord laid eyes on [the man known throughout [the state of Louisiana]258-the state of louisiana]257-the man known throughout the state of louisiana as “ the Beast , ”[257-the man known throughout the state of louisiana] [I]1777-lord thought [he]257-the man known throughout the state of louisiana could n’t possibly be as bad as [his]257-the man known throughout the state of louisiana reputation .

As it turned out , [I]1777-lord was wrong .

[He]257-the man known throughout the state of louisiana was worse .

Dressed all in black , standing a head taller than [everyone else]259-everyone else , [his]257-the man known throughout the state of louisiana shoulders so broad [they]260-they cast an ominous shadow over the polished wood floor , [Jackson Boudreaux]487-jackson surveyed [the bustling dining room of [[my]1777-lord restaurant]262-my restaurant with the expression of a king who ’d stumbled upon [a village of [peasants infected with the plague]264-peasants infected with the plague]263-a village of peasants infected with the plague]261-the bustling dining room of my restaurant with the expression of a king who ’d stumbled upon a village of peasants infected with the plague .

[His]257-the man known throughout the state of louisiana lip was curled . [His]257-the man known throughout the state of louisiana eyes were narrowed . [His]257-the man known throughout the state of louisiana nose was stuck so far up in the air , [I]1777-lord wondered if [he]257-the man known throughout the state of louisiana ’d come in from the rain to avoid drowning .

“ [Hoo Lawd]44-lawd ! [We]1714-we got [ourselves]1714-we a loup - garou ! Get the garlic ! ”[266-my sous chef]

Standing beside [me]1777-lord at the stove in [the kitchen]265-the kitchen , [[my]1777-lord sous chef]266-my sous chef , [Ambrosine]45-ambrosine , made the sign of the cross over [her]45-ambrosine ample chest as [she]45-ambrosine peered through the glass wall at [the man]267-hoyt in black . [Eeny]954-eeny , as [she]45-ambrosine was affectionately called by [everyone who knew [her]45-ambrosine]268-everyone who knew her , was [a retired voodoo priestess with a collection of superstitions almost as elaborate as [her]45-ambrosine African tribal - print caftans]269-a retired voodoo priestess with a collection of superstitions almost as elaborate as her african tribal - print caftans .

“ Garlic is for [vampires]1715-vampires , not werewolves , [Eeny]954-eeny , ”[1777-lord] [I]1777-lord said , gazing past the tables of diners to [the hostess]270-the hostess stand at the front of [the restaurant]271-the restaurant , where [the man with the presence of thunderclouds]267-hoyt stood glowering at [the hostess]270-the hostess , [Pepper]47-pepper . [The poor girl]272-the poor girl was visibly shrinking under the weight of [his]272-the poor girl stare .

A flash of irritation made [me]1777-lord frown .

It was the first , and mildest , of many such flashes [I]1777-lord ’d have tonight .

“ That ai n’t [no werewolf]1716-no werewolf , or [no vampire , ”]1716-no werewolf[267-hoyt] grumbled a voice to [my]1777-lord right .

[I]1777-lord glanced at [[my]1777-lord pastry chef]273-my pastry chef . [Hoyt]267-hoyt was a seventysomething Cajun with an accent thicker than bayou sludge , a grizzled white beard , and arthritic hands that still managed to make the best beignets in [New Orleans]1-new orleans . [He]267-hoyt jerked [his]267-hoyt chin toward [the newcomer]274-the newcomer , then turned [his]267-hoyt attention back to the giant ball of dough on the floured wood board on the counter in front of [him]267-hoyt .

“ [I]267-hoyt recognize [his]267-hoyt face from the papers , ”[267-hoyt] said [Hoyt]267-hoyt . “ That there is the boodoo tête [de cabri]49-de cabri , [Mr. Boudreaux Bourbon]50-mr. boudreaux Jr. [himself]50-mr. boudreaux . ”[267-hoyt]

“ Well butter [my]1777-lord butt and call [me]1777-lord a biscuit , ”[1777-lord] [I]1777-lord said , panicking .

[My]1777-lord panic was n’t because [Hoyt]267-hoyt had called the mysterious new arrival [a goat - headed bully]275-a goat - headed bully . [Hoyt]267-hoyt had a way of describing [people]276-people that was as colorful as the Mardi Gras parade . It was because [that particular goat - headed bully]275-a goat - headed bully was heir to [the world]277-the world ’s number one best - selling bourbon empire .

A bourbon [I]1777-lord had created [my]1777-lord entire spring menu around .

It was a menu that had been extremely well received by [[my]1777-lord guests]278-my guests and the cause for a surge in reservations . It was getting fantastic reviews from [local food critics]279-local food critics and had even just this month received a glowing mention in [Gourmet]2-gourmet magazine .

It was a menu , in all honesty , packed so full of love and soul and hope and sweat that it was like it was [[my]1777-lord own baby]280-my own baby . [I]1777-lord ’d spent months preparing it , testing it , and fine - tuning it until it was perfect .

But having [Jackson Boudreaux]487-jackson [himself]487-jackson come in to dine was an event [I]1777-lord was completely unprepared for .

[I]1777-lord knew [he]275-a goat - headed bully lived in [New Orleans]1-new orleans — [I]1777-lord read the papers , too , after all — but had heard so much talk of [him]275-a goat - headed bully being unsociable and hermitlike , [I]1777-lord thought it unlikely [he]275-a goat - headed bully ’d ever show up at [my]1777-lord door , even if [[his]275-a goat - headed bully family]281-his family bourbon had inspired the menu .

Now here [he]275-a goat - headed bully was .

All six - foot - scowling - three of [him]275-a goat - headed bully .

Scaring the wits out of [[my]1777-lord hostess]282-my hostess and sending an eerie hush through [[my]1777-lord dining room]283-my dining room .

“ How did [I]1777-lord miss [his]275-a goat - headed bully name on the reservations list ? ”[1777-lord] [I]1777-lord cried . “ If [I]1777-lord ’d known [he]275-a goat - headed bully was coming , [I]1777-lord ’d have made sure to give [him]275-a goat - headed bully the best table ! ”[1777-lord]

[Eeny]954-eeny said , “ [Pepper]47-pepper just seated [a family of eight]1717-a family of eight at the best table . It ’s an anniversary party , boo . [They]1717-a family of eight ’ll probably be there for hours . ”[954-eeny]

[I]1777-lord groaned . [I]1777-lord was tempted to go out and find a table for [him]275-a goat - headed bully [myself]1777-lord , but [we]284-we were swamped in [the kitchen]265-the kitchen . [I]1777-lord ’d just have to trust [Pepper]47-pepper to do [her]47-pepper best to fit [him]275-a goat - headed bully in somewhere as fast as [she]47-pepper could .

“ [Y’all]51-y’all get back to work ! ”[1777-lord] [I]1777-lord instructed [the rest of [the kitchen staff , who had stopped what [they]286-the rest of the kitchen staff , who had stopped what they were doing to stare at jackson boudreaux like everyone else in the place were doing to stare at [Jackson Boudreaux]487-jackson like [everyone else]259-everyone else in [the place]288-the place]286-the rest of the kitchen staff , who had stopped what they were doing to stare at jackson boudreaux like everyone else in the place]286-the rest of the kitchen staff , who had stopped what they were doing to stare at jackson boudreaux like everyone else in the place .

When [no one]289-no one moved , [I]1777-lord clapped [my]1777-lord hands . [The staff]290-the staff jumped back into action , knowing that a clap meant business . [I]1777-lord never raised [my]1777-lord voice with [them]290-the staff , even when [I]1777-lord was angry , which was rare . [I]1777-lord had a naturally sunny disposition .

It was about to be put to the test .

“ [Henri]52-henri , [I]1777-lord need more pepper jelly ! ”[1777-lord] [I]1777-lord called to one of [[my]1777-lord line cooks]291-my line cooks as [I]1777-lord turned [my]1777-lord attention back to the ramekins of duck étouffée [I]1777-lord was plating . Every dish that left [the kitchen]265-the kitchen did so only after a final inspection from [me]1777-lord . As [Henri]52-henri rushed over with a container of the homemade spicy jelly , [I]1777-lord pushed all thoughts of [Jackson Boudreaux]487-jackson aside to concentrate on [my]1777-lord task .

When finished , [I]1777-lord quickly handed the plates off to a waiting server . Two more dishes needing final inspection instantly took [their]290-the staff place from a server on [my]1777-lord other side . [The restaurant]271-the restaurant was filled to capacity , and at only six o’clock [I]1777-lord knew [I]1777-lord was in for a long night . [I]1777-lord could n’t have been happier .

After all , this was [my]1777-lord dream come true . [I]1777-lord ’d grown up in [the kitchen of [[my]1777-lord mama ’s restaurant]271-the restaurant]265-the kitchen and had been saving and scrimping for years to open [my]1777-lord own . Cooking was in [my]1777-lord blood as much as jazz music and [the Saints]294-the saints .

[My]1777-lord happiness took its first hit when [the hostess]270-the hostess burst through the swinging metal kitchen doors in tears .

[I]1777-lord looked up at [her]270-the hostess in surprise . “ [Pepper]47-pepper ! What on [earth]1718-earth — ”[1777-lord]

“ That egg - suckin ’ son of a motherless goat can kiss [my]47-pepper ass ! ”[47-pepper] cried [Pepper]47-pepper , swiping angrily at [her]270-the hostess watering eyes so [her]270-the hostess mascara smudged all over [her]270-the hostess cheeks .

[Pepper]47-pepper swore like [a sailor]296-a sailor , wore too much makeup , had hair dyed an unholy shade of streetwalker red and skirts as short as [her]270-the hostess heels were tall , but [she]270-the hostess was [a genuinely sweet girl who had a way with [people]276-people]297-a genuinely sweet girl who had a way with people . [The regulars]299-the regulars loved [her]270-the hostess .

Besides , this was [the French Quarter]300-the french quarter . If [I]1777-lord required [a hostess who looked like [a sexless nun]302-a sexless nun]301-a hostess who looked like a sexless nun , [I]1777-lord ’d be seating the tables [myself]1777-lord .

[I]1777-lord took [Pepper]47-pepper by the arm and steered [her]270-the hostess through [the kitchen]265-the kitchen to the back , near the walk - in freezer . The last thing [I]1777-lord wanted was [[my]1777-lord guests]278-my guests getting a side of [Pepper]47-pepper ’s notoriously salty mouth with [their]278-my guests gumbo .

[I]1777-lord handed [Pepper]47-pepper a tissue . “ What ’s going on ? ”[1777-lord]

[Pepper]47-pepper dabbed at [her]270-the hostess eyes and dramatically sniffled . “ [That man who just came in]1719-that man who just came in — ”[47-pepper]

[My]1777-lord stomach dropped . “ [Mr. Boudreaux]487-jackson ? ”[1777-lord]

[Pepper]47-pepper nodded , then launched into an outraged rant .

“ [He]1719-that man who just came in said [he]1719-that man who just came in wanted a table , and [I]47-pepper told [him]1719-that man who just came in unfortunately [we]1720-we were fully committed , and [he]1719-that man who just came in said what the hell did that mean , and [I]47-pepper tried to nicely explain that [we]1720-we did n’t have any available tables , and then [he]1719-that man who just came in said all snottylike , ‘ Do n’t [you]487-jackson know who [I]47-pepper am ! ’ and demanded [I]47-pepper find [him]1719-that man who just came in a table , and [I]47-pepper said [I]47-pepper just told [you]487-jackson there are n’t any tables available , [sir]1721-rayford , and there ’s a waiting list a mile long , but [he]1719-that man who just came in cut [me]47-pepper off and said — really mean , too , [he]1719-that man who just came in ’s like a crossbred dog!—that [his]1719-that man who just came in name was all over [our]1720-we menu and if [I]47-pepper did n’t get [him]1719-that man who just came in a table , [he]1719-that man who just came in ’d make sure [our]1720-we name was all over the papers , and not in a good way , either , because [he]1719-that man who just came in knew all the press ! So it was like [he]1719-that man who just came in threatened [me]47-pepper , and when [I]47-pepper got upset , [he]1719-that man who just came in growled at [me]47-pepper to stop sniveling ! Sniveling ! Does n’t that just dill [my]47-pepper pickle ! ”[47-pepper]

[Pepper]47-pepper ended [her]47-pepper rant with a stamp of [her]47-pepper stiletto heel .

[I]1777-lord pinched the bridge of [my]1777-lord nose between two fingers and sighed . So [Mr. Boudreaux]487-jackson did n’t have a reservation after all . And trusting [Pepper]47-pepper to do [her]47-pepper best had n’t exactly worked out as [I]1777-lord ’d hoped .

“ All right , [Pepper]47-pepper , first thing — calm down . Take a deep breath . ”[47-pepper]

[Grudgingly]53-grudgingly , [she]47-pepper did .

“ Good . Now go back out there and tell [him]1719-that man who just came in — nicely , please — that [the owner]1722-the owner will be out to speak with [him]1719-that man who just came in in a few minutes . [Neither of [us]348-we]349-neither of us said anything . The moment stretched out until it became uncomfortable , and then intolerable . Staring into [his]344-that man eyes was like being physically attacked .

[He]344-that man leaned back against the leather booth , spread [his]344-that man hands flat against the tabletop , and examined [me]1777-lord the way [a scientist]350-a scientist might examine a germ under a microscope . [THREE

FOUR

[BIANCA

Whoever]58-bianca coined the phrase beauty sleep had obviously never seen [me]1777-lord in the morning .

[I]1777-lord splashed cold water on [my]1777-lord face , pressed a wet washcloth to [my]1777-lord lids , and held it there for a minute , to no effect . When [I]1777-lord opened [my]1777-lord eyes , [I]1777-lord looked just as bad as [I]1777-lord did before .

But if [Jackson Boudreaux]487-jackson was serious about [his]1721-rayford threat to sue , [I]1777-lord ’d have to revamp everything , fast . Then [I]1777-lord supposed [I]1777-lord ’d have to hire [myself]1777-lord [a lawyer]386-a lawyer .

Stuck - up son of a lazy - eyed catfish !

[I]1777-lord pinned [my]1777-lord hair into a bun , then smoothed a dollop of pomade over all the rebellious little flyaways staging a protest around [my]1777-lord hairline . Then [I]1777-lord brushed [my]1777-lord teeth and got dressed , not bothering with makeup . There was no concealer on earth that could tackle [my]1777-lord undereye bags today , and [I]1777-lord ’d never quite mastered the art of applying mascara . Or lipstick , for that matter . [I]1777-lord looked like [I]1777-lord ’d eaten a box of red crayons .

[The oldest African American neighborhood in [the United States]4-the united states]393-the oldest african american neighborhood in the united states , Tremé was the musical heart of [New Orleans]1-new orleans , going all the way back to [the seventeen hundreds]394-the seventeen hundreds , when [slaves]395-slaves were allowed to gather in [Congo Square]5-here on Sundays to dance and play music . But it ’s a bad idea for [tourists]397-tourists to take a stroll after dark . Drugs are a problem , and jobs are in short supply . [CREOLE SHRIMP]86-creole shrimp AND GRITS

Makes 4 servings

4 cups water

1 cup stone - ground grits

3 tablespoons butter

2 cups shredded sharp cheddar cheese

1 pound raw shrimp , peeled and deveined

6 slices bacon , chopped

4 teaspoons lemon juice

2 tablespoons fresh parsley , chopped

1 cup scallions , sliced

1 clove garlic , minced

kosher salt

freshly ground pepper

Preparation

In stockpot , bring water to a boil . Reduce heat to simmer , add grits , salt , and pepper , and cook until water is absorbed , about 20 minutes .

[Remove]87-remove from heat and stir in butter and cheese .

Fry the bacon in a large skillet until browned . [Remove]87-remove to paper towels , drain well , and chop .

[Rinse]88-rinse shrimp and pat dry . Add into bacon grease and cook until shrimp turn pink . Do not overcook .

Add lemon juice , chopped bacon , parsley , scallions , and garlic , and sauté for 3 minutes .

[Spoon]89-spoon cooked grits into serving bowls . Add shrimp mixture on top . Serve immediately .

Then [I]1777-lord had a brilliant idea .

SIX

BIANCA

Stage three . It sounded more like a movie set than a diagnosis .

“ It ’s a catering job . A onetime thing . [BIANCA ’S OLD CUBAN]127-bianca ’s old cuban

Makes 1 serving

2 ounces prosecco

1½ ounces bourbon

1 ounce simple syrup

¾ ounce fresh lime juice

2 dashes Angostura bitters

fresh mint leaves to garnish

Preparation

Combine all ingredients except prosecco in a shaker and fill with ice .

Shake vigorously to chill .

Strain into a chilled coupe glass .

Top with prosecco and garnish with mint .

Simple Syrup Preparation

Combine 1 cup sugar and 1 cup water in saucepan and bring to a boil , stirring until sugar is dissolved . Remove from heat . Store leftovers in airtight container in the refrigerator for up to two weeks .

ELEVEN

[BIANCA]58-bianca

By the time [Jackson]487-jackson ’s charity benefit rolled around , [I]1777-lord was jumpy as a cat on a hot tin roof .

[Doc Halloran]80-doc halloran had told [us]698-us what to expect in the way of side effects of the chemo , but neither [Mama]1754-mama nor [I]1777-lord was prepared for the reality of it . [She]695-good girl felt fine for the first few days , and then everything kicked in with one big wallop .

[I]1777-lord went with [her]695-good girl every day to [the hospital]699-the hospital for the first week , then helped out at [the house]1724-the house during the second , trying to get [her]695-good girl to eat and fielding all [her]695-good girl callers , turning them away with excuses that [she]695-good girl had the flu . [I]1777-lord did n’t think it was right [she]695-good girl did n’t tell [him]701-the poor colonel what was really going on , but it was n’t [my]1777-lord place to make that decision .

“ Perfectly normal , ”[80-doc halloran] said [Doc Halloran]80-doc halloran every time [I]1777-lord called [him]80-doc halloran in a panic . “ It ’s a sign the medicine is working , [Bianca]58-bianca . Just let it take its course . ”[1777-lord]

Twice [he]80-doc halloran called [the house]1724-the house . Both times [I]1777-lord saw the number and let it ring , flipping the bird at the phone . When the answering machine came on , [he]80-doc halloran hung up with a heavy sigh , like [I]1777-lord was being unreasonable .

[I]1777-lord gave [Mama]1754-mama a pass on account of [her]1754-mama being sick , but there was no way [I]1777-lord was gon na listen to a single word [he]80-doc halloran had to say . [Jackson]152-jackson said , “ Coming up next [we]1967-our ’re going to start the auction . [I]152-jackson ’m sure [you]1973-you ’ll all be very generous to help [[our]1967-our wounded vets]1974-our wounded vets , right ? ”[152-jackson]

More cheering .

Then [he]152-jackson looked out across the heads of [[everyone]1801-everyone in [the room]312-the room]757-everyone in the room and spotted [me]1777-lord standing in the doorway . Even through the distance that separated [us]759-us , [I]1777-lord saw how [his]152-jackson eyes burned .

[He]152-jackson said , “ But before [we]1967-our get to that , [I]152-jackson want to introduce [you]1973-you to [the woman who made [you]1973-you all the delicious food [you]1973-you ’ve been eating this evening]1975-the woman who made you all the delicious food you ’ve been eating this evening . [Jackson]152-jackson extended [his]152-jackson hand . Three hundred heads turned to look at [me]1777-lord .

Inconveniently , the ground did n’t open up and swallow [me]1777-lord whole .

GINGER - ORANGE CHEESECAKE

Makes 8 servings

1½ cups graham cracker crumbs

⅓ cup butter , melted

⅓ cup white sugar

32 ounces cream cheese , softened

⅔ cup white sugar , plus 2 tablespoons

1 cup sour cream , divided

1 tablespoon grated orange peel

4 eggs

2 cups clementine wedges

½ cup finely chopped crystallized ginger

Preparation

Preheat oven to 325 degrees . Mix graham cracker crumbs , butter , and ⅓ cup sugar together . Press on bottom of 9² x 3² springform pan and just enough up sides to seal bottom .

Place cream cheese , ⅔ cup sugar , ½ cup sour cream , and orange peel in food processor . Cover and process about 3 minutes or until smooth . Add eggs . Cover and process until well blended . Spread over crust .

[Bake]154-bake 1 hour 20 minutes , or until center is set . Cool on wire rack for 15 minutes . Using spatula around edges to loosen , remove side of pan .

[Refrigerate]155-refrigerate uncovered 3 hours or until chilled , then cover and continue refrigerating at least 4 hours , but not longer than 48 hours .

Mix ½ cup sour cream and 2 tablespoons sugar and spread over top of cheesecake . Top with fresh fruit and crystallized ginger . Store uneaten portion covered with foil in fridge .

TWELVE

[BIANCA]58-bianca

Though [I]1777-lord wanted to turn and bolt , [I]1777-lord did n’t . [The man]267-hoyt had paid [me]1777-lord an obscene amount of money for this job , after all . And [I]1777-lord was [a professional]761-a professional . [I]1777-lord would n’t embarrass [him]267-hoyt in front of all [[his]267-hoyt guests]762-his guests by refusing [his]267-hoyt request .

Also , [I]1777-lord was intrigued by [this new Jackson]763-this new jackson , [this well - dressed stranger who spoke so eloquently about honor and selflessness and used words like please]763-this new jackson .

[I]1777-lord did n’t think that word was in [his]763-this new jackson vocabulary .

So it was with curiosity — and a healthy dose of embarrassment — that [I]1777-lord walked around the perimeter of the tables and climbed [the few stairs]764-the few stairs to [the stage]740-the stage .

Then shock took over as [Jackson]152-jackson wound [his]152-jackson arm around [my]1777-lord shoulders , pulled [me]1777-lord against [his]152-jackson side , and smiled down at [me]1777-lord . [I]1777-lord was too busy trying not to keel over in surprise to pay much attention to how perfectly [I]1777-lord fit under [his]152-jackson arm , how snugly [I]1777-lord nestled against the solid bulk of [his]152-jackson body .

How hard [he]152-jackson was , all over .

[I]1777-lord ’m definitely hallucinating . Or [Jackson Boudreaux]487-jackson has a twin [no one]289-no one knows about .

A twin that had three long , thin , mysterious scars on the right side of [his]152-jackson face that [his]152-jackson beard had been hiding .

Oh [my]1777-lord God .

And what had made [him]1777-lord get that semicolon tattoo .

And why [I]1777-lord suddenly wanted to know everything about [him]1777-lord .

[I]1777-lord did n’t sleep a wink that night . [I]1777-lord did n’t toss and turn , either . [I]1777-lord just lay on [my]1777-lord back in the dark staring up at [my]1777-lord bedroom ceiling , [my]1777-lord mind a merry - go - round that would n’t stop spinning .

[He]1777-lord was a puzzle . A puzzle [I]1777-lord ached to figure out , but the charity benefit was over . And with all that had happened last night , [I]1777-lord doubted [Jackson]487-jackson had any desire to see [me]1777-lord again .

In the morning , [I]1777-lord stopped by [Mama]1754-mama ’s as usual . [I]1777-lord found [her]1754-mama in bed , drenched in sweat , miserable with nausea .

[[Her]1754-mama doctor]895-her doctor had mentioned the possibility of having a [home]411-home health - care nurse stop by a few times a week during the day to help out , and that was looking like a good idea .

[I]1777-lord ’d thought [I]1777-lord could take care of everything [myself]1777-lord — running [the restaurant]271-the restaurant and whatever [Mama]1754-mama needed in terms of support and daily care — but [I]1777-lord was beginning to have [my]1777-lord doubts .

The second round of chemo started in a few days . If it was anywhere near as bad as the first , [I]1777-lord was going to need an army of help .

[I]1777-lord boiled a chicken breast and some plain white rice and left it in the fridge with a note in case [she]1754-mama felt a little better later . When [I]1777-lord was about to leave , an envelope on the kitchen table caught [my]1777-lord eye .

It was from [the hospital]699-the hospital . It had n’t been opened .

[I]1777-lord slid [my]1777-lord finger under the glued flap , removed the folded piece of paper , and all the blood drained from [my]1777-lord face .

INVOICE . Big , blocky letters screamed from the upper right - hand corner .

When [I]1777-lord read the amount due at the bottom , [I]1777-lord sank into the kitchen chair .

Then [I]1777-lord had [myself]1777-lord a good , long cry .

[BIANCA ’S BLACKBERRY & BOURBON COBBLER]19-bianca ’s blackberry & bourbon cobbler

Makes 8–10 servings

12 cups fresh blackberries

¾ cup raw sugar

¼ cup high - quality bourbon

cooking spray

½ vanilla bean

1 cup granulated sugar

2 cups all - purpose flour

1 tablespoon plus 2 teaspoons baking powder

½ teaspoon table salt

1 teaspoon lemon zest

1½ cups milk

1 egg

¾ teaspoon vanilla extract

6 tablespoons butter , melted

Preparation

Preheat oven to 350 degrees . Combine blackberries , raw sugar , and bourbon in a large bowl . Transfer mixture to a 13² x 9² baking dish lightly greased with cooking spray .

Split vanilla bean , and scrape seeds into granulated sugar , making sure vanilla bean seeds are distributed evenly .

Sift together flour , baking powder , salt , and granulated sugar mixture into a large bowl . Stir in lemon zest . Whisk together milk , egg , and vanilla extract , and then stir into dry ingredients . Add melted butter and stir .

Pour batter evenly over fruit . Place dish on a baking sheet .

[Bake]154-bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour and 10 minutes or until crust is deep golden brown .

FIFTEEN

JACKSON

[I]1777-lord was barely listening to [[my]1777-lord father]372-my father prattling into [my]1777-lord ear as [I]1777-lord stared out the window of [the library]1845-the library into the sunny spring morning outside . [My]1777-lord attention was preoccupied with thoughts of [Bianca Hardwick]58-bianca .

[I]1777-lord folded [my]1777-lord arms over [my]1777-lord chest and stood with [my]1777-lord legs braced apart , like [I]1777-lord was preparing for a group of suits from [the bank]915-the bank to knock down the front door and [I]1777-lord ’d have to fight [them]916-them to the death for possession of [the house]1724-the house . “ Maybe not , but [you]487-jackson know as well as [I]1777-lord do that [I]1777-lord ’m never going back to [Kentucky]3-kentucky . ”[1777-lord]

[Rayford]1721-rayford smiled . It looked a little mysterious . “ So that leaves marriage . Who ’s [the lucky girl]2058-the lucky girl ? ”[1721-rayford]

FRENCH QUARTER BEIGNETS

Makes about 3 dozen

1½ cups warm water

½ cup white sugar

1 envelope active dry yeast

2 eggs

1¼ teaspoon salt

1 cup evaporated milk

7 cups all - purpose flour

¼ cup shortening

1 quart vegetable oil

3 cups confectioners ’ sugar

Preparation

Mix water , sugar , and yeast in large bowl and let sit for 10 minutes .

In another bowl , beat the eggs , salt , and evaporated milk together . Stir egg mixture into yeast mixture .

Add 3 cups of the flour to the egg / yeast mixture . Stir to combine .

Add the shortening and mix . Continue to stir while slowly adding the remaining flour until all ingredients are well combined .

Place dough on lightly floured surface and knead until smooth .

Cover dough with plastic wrap or towel . Let rise at room temperature for 2–3 hours .

Preheat oil in a deep fryer to 350 degrees .

Roll the dough out to ¼² thickness and cut into 2² squares . Deep fry in batches , flipping constantly , until golden . ( If beignets do n’t pop up , oil is n’t hot enough . )

Drain on paper towels .

Shake confectioners ’ sugar onto hot beignets . Serve warm .

NINETEEN

BIANCA

[I]1777-lord left the same way [I]1777-lord arrived : in [a cab]1000-a cab , by [myself]1777-lord , fraught with anxiety .

If [[my]1777-lord mother]390-my mother knew what [I]1777-lord ’d just agreed to , [she]390-my mother ’d slap [me]1777-lord silly .

[She]390-my mother knew [I]1777-lord ’d gotten the twenty thousand from [Jackson]487-jackson for the catering event , but admitting [I]1777-lord ’d be getting a million for marrying [myself]1777-lord off to [him]1002-him so [I]1777-lord could try to save [her]390-my mother life was another situation altogether .

Knowing there would be a nondisclosure in [our]1003-we contract was actually a relief . It meant [I]1777-lord had a legal obligation to keep [my]1777-lord mouth shut about [my]1777-lord real reason for marrying the Beast .

Now [I]1777-lord just had to figure out what fake reason [I]1777-lord was going to try to sell .

“ [He]1002-him ’s so charming [I]1777-lord could n’t help but fall in love with [him]1002-him , [Mama]1754-mama ! ”[1777-lord] [I]1777-lord muttered sarcastically to [myself]1777-lord . [DAVINA]58-bianca ’S FAMOUS CREOLE JAMBALAYA

Makes 8 servings

½ pound raw bacon , diced

½ pound fresh pork sausage , casings removed

½ pound andouille sausage , sliced

3 tablespoons butter

4 boneless chicken breasts , cut into 1 - inch cubes

1 large yellow onion , diced

1 green bell pepper , diced

3 celery ribs , diced

3 garlic cloves , minced

2 cups long - grain white rice

1 teaspoon dried thyme

2 bay leaves

½ tablespoon chili powder

1½ tablespoons paprika

1 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper

1 teaspoon celery salt

1 can diced tomatoes

2 cups homemade ( or organic ) chicken stock

1 cup good - quality red wine

1½ pounds wild - caught raw shrimp , peeled and deveined

8 scallions , chopped

fresh parsley

Preparation

In a large Dutch oven or high - sided pot , melt butter . Cook bacon and sausages for three to five minutes or until lightly browned , stirring frequently . Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper , add to pot , and cook additional 5 minutes or until browned .

Add onion , bell pepper , celery , and garlic and cook until soft and fragrant , about 10 minutes . If pot seems dry , drizzle lightly with olive oil .

Add rice , thyme , bay leaves , paprika , cayenne pepper , and celery salt and stir to mix . Increase heat to high . Add tomatoes , red wine , and chicken stock . Bring to a boil , reduce heat to medium / low , cover pot , and simmer for 15 minutes or until rice is tender .

When rice is done , add shrimp and green onions . [Cook]200-cook on low for additional 10 minutes or until shrimp is pink and cooked through . Remove bay leaves , fluff jambalaya , and serve , garnishing with fresh parsley .

TWENTY - TWO

[BIANCA]58-bianca

After [I]1777-lord hung up with [Jackson]487-jackson , it took a solid fifteen minutes of dithering before [I]1777-lord worked up the nerve to call [[my]1777-lord mother]390-my mother . [She]390-my mother answered on the first ring .

“ Hi , [Mama]1754-mama . How are [you]1754-mama ? ”[58-bianca]

The gentle laugh that came over the line was reassuring . “ [I]390-my mother told [you]1754-mama this morning [I]390-my mother ’m feeling good today , chère . [You]1754-mama worry about [me]390-my mother too much . ”[390-my mother]

“ That ’s good . ”[390-my mother]

After listening to the cavernous silence that followed , [[her]390-my mother mother - bear instincts]1101-her mother - bear instincts kicked in . [She]390-my mother said sharply , “ [Bianca]58-bianca ? What ’s the matter ? ”[390-my mother]

[I]1777-lord stared at the kitten poster on the wall of [[my]1777-lord office]1034-my office until it blurred . “ Uh . . . ”[1777-lord] Be brave . [You]1103-you ’ve got this . Terrified , [I]1777-lord cleared [my]1777-lord throat . “ There ’s [someone [I]1777-lord ’d like [you]1103-you to meet]2264-someone i ’d like you to meet . ”[1777-lord]

[She]390-my mother did n’t even miss a beat . “ Who , [Jackson Boudreaux]487-jackson ? ”[390-my mother]

[My]1777-lord jaw hit the desk . When [I]1777-lord recovered [my]1777-lord wits , [I]1777-lord said , “ How did [you]1103-you know ? ”[1777-lord]

“ [Sweetheart]201-sweetheart , [I]954-eeny ’ve known [Eeny]954-eeny for going on fifty years . Did [you]1103-you think [she]954-eeny would n’t call [me]954-eeny when [a man]267-hoyt barged into [[your]1103-you kitchen]2266-your kitchen and announced [you]1103-you were getting married like [you]1103-you ’d just won [the Publishers Clearing House sweepstakes]2267-the publishers clearing house sweepstakes ? ”[954-eeny]

[Eeny]954-eeny ! [I]1777-lord should ’ve known [she]954-eeny ’d blab ! The air leaked from [my]1777-lord lungs like a punctured balloon .

[Mama]1754-mama said , “ Well , [he]1105-he might have a reputation for being too big for [his]1105-he britches , but [the man]267-hoyt must have some sense in [his]267-hoyt head to fall in love with [you]1106-you . ”[1754-mama]

Love ? [I]1777-lord almost slipped into a coma . But what could [I]1777-lord say ? No , actually [we]1104-we ’re only getting married to save [his]1105-he inheritance and [your]1106-you life ?

That would so not go over .

[Her]954-eeny tone became businesslike . “ Bring [him]1105-he by tomorrow at ten o’clock . And be prepared to leave for a few minutes so [I]954-eeny can give [him]1105-he the business . [He]1105-he does n’t get to marry into [this family]2043-this family unless [he]1105-he ’s good enough for [you]1106-you . ”[954-eeny]

[She]954-eeny hung up , leaving [me]1777-lord staring in bewilderment at the phone . The dreamlike feeling intensified .

[Body]202-body snatchers , [I]1777-lord thought . That was the only rational explanation for [her]954-eeny nonchalance . [Aliens]203-aliens had stolen [[my]1777-lord mother]390-my mother and replaced [her]954-eeny with a robot look - alike . Right now [the robot]1108-the robot was sitting blank eyed in [Mama]1754-mama ’s armchair downloading instructions from [the mother ship]1109-the mother ship .

Or maybe [the chemo]1110-the chemo had unraveled something inside [her]954-eeny brain .

Or [I]1777-lord ’d been involved in [a serious car]1111-a serious car accident and was lying in a hospital bed somewhere , doped up to the gills , [my]1777-lord opiate - soaked brain manufacturing this whole thing .

“ Only one way to find out , ”[1777-lord] [I]1777-lord said aloud to [the empty room]1112-the empty room and then cackled like [a lunatic]852-a lunatic .

[I]1777-lord was taking [the Beast]114-the beast [home]411-home to meet [[my]1777-lord mother]390-my mother . [The world]277-the world had officially come to an end .

At five minutes to ten o’clock the next morning , [I]1777-lord sat on the edge of the sofa in [[Mama]1754-mama ’s living room]1116-mama ’s living room , pretending [I]1777-lord was n’t having a brain embolism while [I]1777-lord waited for [Jackson Boudreaux]487-jackson to knock on the front door .

[Regal]204-regal in purple , [Mama]1754-mama sat in [her]1754-mama big white armchair , openly studying [me]1777-lord . “ [[Doc Halloran]80-doc halloran ’s office]2269-doc halloran ’s office called yesterday to confirm the surgery , ”[1754-mama] [she]1754-mama said suddenly .

“ Next Wednesday at nine , ”[1777-lord] [I]1777-lord said , nodding . “ [I]1777-lord remember . ”[1777-lord] [I]1777-lord glanced at the clock on the wall . Four minutes to ten . T minus four minutes . Three . Two . [My]1777-lord knee started to bounce .

“ In case anything goes wrong — ”[1777-lord]

[My]1777-lord head snapped around . “ Nothing will go wrong ! ”[1777-lord] [I]1777-lord said too loudly .

[She]1754-mama smiled at [me]1777-lord , amused . “ As [I]1754-mama was saying . [I]1754-mama ’ll leave it on the kitchen table before [we]2270-we go to [the hospital]699-the hospital . ”[1754-mama]

[I]1777-lord swallowed around the lump in [my]1777-lord throat . “ Documents ? ”[1777-lord]

“ [My]1777-lord will . The title to [the house]1724-the house . Copies of insurance policies and bank statements . [You]1777-lord know , documents . ”[1777-lord]

[I]1777-lord pressed [my]1777-lord cold fingertips to [my]1777-lord closed eyelids and breathed deeply .

“ Oh , chère , ”[1754-mama] said [Mama]1754-mama softly . “ Dying is n’t the worst thing that ’s ever happened to [me]1754-mama . It ’s just the only thing [I]1754-mama wo n’t live through . ”[1754-mama]

“ How many times do [I]1777-lord have to tell [you]1777-lord ? ”[1777-lord] [I]1777-lord said , [my]1777-lord voice breaking . “ [You]1777-lord ’re not dying ! ”[1777-lord]

[She]1754-mama waved a hand impatiently as if to swat away a fly .

TWENTY - THREE

JACKSON

Though [she]1778-baby only lived a few blocks away from [[her]1778-baby mother]847-her mother , [Bianca]58-bianca was in no shape to walk [home]1724-the house . [I]1777-lord ’ve seen [someone]1742-someone hit in the head with a shovel who had more presence of mind than [she]58-bianca was displaying .

[I]1777-lord held the car door open for [her]58-bianca . [She]58-bianca inserted [herself]58-bianca into the seat with the grace of [a zombie , all jerking legs and stiff arms]1155-a zombie , all jerking legs and stiff arms , the opposite of the way [she]58-bianca normally moved .

“ [I]1777-lord did n’t think having [me]1777-lord meet [[your]1156-you mother]58-bianca would be so traumatizing for [you]1156-you , ”[1777-lord] [I]1777-lord said once [I]1777-lord was seated behind the wheel .

[Bianca]58-bianca laughed . It was the noise a dog made when [you]1156-you stepped on its tail . “ [You]1156-you asked [[my]58-bianca mother]58-bianca for permission to marry [me]58-bianca , ”[58-bianca] [she]58-bianca said .

“ [I]58-bianca did . ”[58-bianca]

[She]58-bianca studied [me]1777-lord in silence as [we]1160-we drove . [I]1777-lord liked it , having [her]58-bianca attention focused on [me]1777-lord like that . [I]1777-lord turned the radio off .

“ Wait . ”[58-bianca] [Bianca]58-bianca looked out the window in confusion . “ [We]1160-we ’re going the wrong way . ”[58-bianca]

[TWENTY - FIVE

“ No , ”[1721-rayford] [he]1721-rayford snapped .

[CREOLE OKRA GUMBO]221-creole okra gumbo

Makes 6 servings

4 tablespoons butter

kosher salt

1 tablespoon cayenne pepper

1½ pounds boneless chicken thighs , skin removed , cut into pieces

4 ounces tasso ham , cut into 1² cubes

3 cloves garlic , minced

2 teaspoons thyme , minced

1 bay leaf

1 yellow onion , minced

1 red bell pepper , minced

1 tablespoon fresh parsley , minced

6 large fresh tomatoes , skin , core , and seeds removed

2 tablespoons tomato paste

6 cups chicken stock

1 pound okra , trimmed , sliced ½ inch thick

6 cups cooked white rice

Preparation

Melt butter in Dutch oven .

Season chicken with salt and cayenne on both sides , cook for 10 minutes or until browned .

Add tasso and garlic , cook for 5 minutes .

Add thyme , bay leaf , onion , and bell pepper . Cook until browned , 5–10 minutes .

Add parsley , tomatoes , and tomato paste . Cook 5 minutes or until softened .

Add chicken stock , bring to a boil . Reduce heat to low and simmer until chicken is cooked through and gumbo has thickened , about 1 hour .

Melt remaining butter in a nonstick skillet . Cook okra until slightly crisp , 8–10 minutes , then add to gumbo . [Cook gumbo]200-cook additional 15 minutes . Discard bay leaf .

Serve over hot white rice .

THIRTY

BIANCA

BLOODY DIXIE

Makes 4 servings

1 32 - ounce bottle of tomato juice

2 ounces vodka

1 tablespoon freshly grated horseradish ( or prepared )

1 tablespoon lemon juice

1 tablespoon hot sauce

1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce

dash of celery salt

dash of pepper

4 slices cooked bacon

4 ribs celery

Preparation

Pour out ¼ cup tomato juice from bottle .

Mix horseradish , lemon juice , hot sauce , [Worcestershire]241-worcestershire , celery salt , and pepper into the remaining tomato juice in bottle and shake vigorously .

Add ice to 4 highball glasses .

Pour 2 ounces vodka over ice in each glass ( or to [your]1535-your taste ) .

Add tomato juice mix to fill .

Stir , then garnish with bacon and celery .

THIRTY - FOUR

[I]1777-lord spoke to [the church]33-moonstar ranch and set [Mama]1754-mama ’s funeral for Wednesday at noon . So the day [she]1754-mama was supposed to have life - saving surgery was the day [she]1754-mama ’d be buried . [I]1777-lord did n’t want to examine the coincidence .

[I]1777-lord survived on coffee and adrenaline , forgetting to shower until [Eeny]954-eeny told [me]1777-lord [I]1777-lord smelled like a goat . By Wednesday morning [I]1777-lord was a wreck . [I]1777-lord did n’t know how [I]1777-lord ’d make it through the funeral without collapsing .

But once again , [Jackson]487-jackson ’s strength shored [me]1777-lord up .

Then [he]1644-he gave [[my]1777-lord little boat]1645-my little boat a hard push into [rough waters]1646-rough waters and set [me]1777-lord free .

THIRTY - SEVEN

BIANCA

It was a bracing fifty - eight degrees , the sky a clear , brilliant blue above [our]1647-our heads . [Eeny]954-eeny stood to [my]1777-lord left , crying softly into a handkerchief . [Jackson]487-jackson was to [my]1777-lord right , stony as the inside of [my]1777-lord heart .

[His]1656-the priest rough black beard was back . [His]1656-the priest hair had obviously only been finger combed .
